snippet.title: I can see with an A1C of 5.7 and an avg. BG of 147, I should have an avg of 117. This is really an eyeopener. My Dr. will be interested in this.
snippet.description: ... This converter is really neat. I am on a pump and is easy to see my 7,14 & 30 day avgs. + before & after meals for 7,14 &30 days. When you get an A1C done in a lab as I do because I'm a Med. Tech and can keep track of it every mo. it doesn't tell the right story in my opion. this isn't a question but a few facts. Kay Emmons ...

snippet.title: B/P Meds not working. I am a 42 yr old white male 5'8'' and 200 lbs. I was diagnosed with hypertension when I was 17 and 120 lbs. My bloodpressure avg 144/92.
snippet.description: ... I started taking Zestoretic 10-12.5 about 10 years ago, My B/P avg 145/92, after several years my meds were incresed to 20-12.5 and my B/P remained the same. I stayed on this does for several more years. A few weeks ago my meds were increased again to 20-25, I have been monitoring my B/P very closley and it continues to avg 144/92 but now I also get frequent headaches and feel lighthead daily. I decided to stop taking the meds because I could not handle the Headches and dizzyness,I have been off the meds for a few days and My B\P still avg 144\92. I am seen at a teaching hospital/clinic so I see a different Dr everytime I go and I have explained, and they have seen from my records over the past 10 years that regardless of the dose my B/P runs around same. I have a strong family history of hypertension and I am concerned that My Dr's are not factoring that into the equation and their answer is always increase the dose of the same meds. should I demand a different class of medication? a... ...

snippet.title: I eat two cookies and small icecream a day and avg. 100. Is this ok
snippet.description: ... I have had diabetes one year and exercise daily and eat right kinds of food and watch carbs but have always had a sweet tooth and normally everyday eat a couple cookies and small dish of ice cream or yogurt. I take my sugar once and sometimes twice a day and a1c is 5.5. My doctor says I am doing great so far. I take Junuvia which has really helped me vs. Metformin. I had read on internet that a carb is a carb and 15-20 carbs for two cookies is no worse than same carbs for something else. Jim ...
